thread.title: Western Digital Agrees To Buy SanDisk For $19 Billion
thread.title_full: Western Digital Agrees To Buy SanDisk For $19 Billion

author: Tehelka Web Desk
title: Western Digital Agrees To Buy SanDisk For $19 Billion
text:
Comment 
American computer data storage company,Western Digital, is set to buy SanDisk Corp for around $19 billion. The storage giant officially announced that it has agreed to buy SanDisk Corp. The deals comes soon after the speculation that SanDisk was shopping for a buyer. 
According to reports, the deal values SanDisk at $86.50 a share, which is a 15% premium on the previous dayâ€™s closing price, giving the company a value of $15.4 billion. SanDisk is currently up 4.78% in pre-market trading. 
With this deal, two of the largest storage companies becomes a union. SanDisk CEO Sanjay Mehrotra is expected to join the Western Digital board upon the closing of the deal. Western Digital CEO Steve Milligan will continue in that role. 
For ICT systems, WD supplies hard drives and SSDs and it also sells external drives directly to consumers. SanDisk is the third-largest manufacturer of flash memory worldwide, and is best known for its memory card and USB drive business. 
The two IT giants are currently headquartered in California and have been operating for decades. SanDisk has been a long-time partner of Toshiba. */
